title: Social Worker/Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cook Inlet Tribal Council (Anchorage, AK) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was great. They scheduled with me, sent link for zoom meeting, and gave me over an hour of their time. I was able to ask questions and get more information.
Interview Questions: Lots of "tell us about a time" questions.

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cook Inlet Tribal Council (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to come to the school at 5pm at a morning job fair. I was also asked would I be interested in becoming certified in MOS. I said yes. When I got to the interview I was instructed on how to get free tuition to attend the school. I was then told that the position is being reviewed by someone else who has been interviewing for 3 weeks. I was told "I don't want to mislead you but if something comes up we will call you."
Interview Questions: I wasn't asked any questions, I was mislead.

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cook Inlet Tribal Council (Anchorage, AK) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a three person panel interview process with scenarios of workforce and life skills questions. It was to designed to find the best candidates to help provide services to the participants and a win/win. It costs money to hire/train/retain employees and if the candidates met the mission goals it was aligned to work for the organization, employee, and participants.
